div1.p: Hench would like to acquire a copy of a photograph.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Machado de Cardenas, January 6, 1942
div1.opener:
M
January 6, 1942
Dr. Pedro Machado (de Cardenas)
Jefe de Redaccion y Administrador
Revista de la Sanidad Militar
Ciudad Militar
Havana, Cuba
My dear Cardenas:
div1.p:
I wrote you the enclosed letter on November 24, 1941
and since I have not heard from you I fear that my letter was
never received. I would appreciate greatly receiving a glossy
print of the photograph mentioned herein.

We here at the Mayo Clinic are glad indeed to have
in our library all the copies of your Revista de la Sanidad
Militar. I assume that you are receiving the Proceedings of
the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings. If not, I should be glad
indeed to see that you get them complimentary as a small
token of my appreciation. for your courtesy in helping me
get the airplane photograph that was in your medical journal.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
